The boil-water notice and low water pressure point to long-standing infrastructural problems in the Blackest city in the country. Jackson's acute water crisis began with a snowstorm during the week of Feb. 15. During the storm, almost all of Jackson was without water.

Many of us are familiar with the Flint, MI water crisis, but the crisis of safe water for human use goes far beyond Flint. On March 15, 2021, the city of Jackson, MS still did not have water restored to all parts of the city and were on a boil water notice. https://t.co/xJfITnK977
